prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "UserID": ["User1", "User2", "User3", "User4", "User5", "User6"],
    "SessionDurationMinutes": [15, 25, 10, 30, 22, 18],
    "PagesViewed": [5, 8, 3, 10, 7, 6],
    "DeviceType": ["Desktop", "Mobile", "Desktop", "Mobile", "Desktop", "Mobile"],
    "Converted": [True, False, False, True, True, False]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Calculate and print the average "SessionDurationMinutes". 2) Count and print the number of users for each "DeviceType". Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, calculate the average session duration, and count users by device type.
